30 30

Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver

The 30 30 Campaign was created in 2013 to celebrate AIDS Vancouver’s 30th anniversary. The campaign pieces together the dynamic history of HIV in Vancouver, told by and for those who where there.

Prev

1983

The Gay Founding Fathers

In 1983

  • Apple launched Macintosh, announced by the famous commercial '1984'. LINK
  • Michael Jackson performs 'Billie Jean' where he performs the moonwalk for the first time. LINK
  • Margaret Thatcher is elected, leading Britain’s Conservative party for a second term. LINK

Local

  • 7 known cases in Vancouver.
  • Vancouver Lymphadenopathy AIDS Study (VLAS) begins enrollment to study over 700 homosexual men to gain personal information on sexual activity and risk factors that may be a contributor to AIDS. LINK
  • First AIDS Forum is held March 12, 1983 by AIDS Vancouver at the West End Community Centre. Key note speakers included Dr. Brian Willoughby, Michael Maynard, Paul Popham, Geoff Mains, Steven Sacks and Pastor Ernie Lacasse.
  • Dr. Brian Willoughby speaks at the first AIDS Forum and encourages people who have any symptoms of AIDS, or gay men with multiple sex partners, to exclude themselves from giving blood.
  • Fight Fear With The Facts brochure produced by AIDS Vancouver. LINK
  • AIDS Vancouver sets up phone hotline to answer calls from the public on AIDS.
  • First AIDS Vancouver Support Group. LINK

Statistics

  • 7 reported AIDS cases in BC. LINK
  • 64 cases reported in Canada. LINK
  • 33 countries reporting AIDS. LINK

Global

  • Pasteur Institute isolates the HIV Virus for the first time. LINK
  • First known 'safe sex' publication — 'How to Have Sex in an Epidemic', by Richard Berkowitz is published. LINK
  • Larry Kramer's essay '1112 and Counting' is published The New York Native. LINK

National

  • AIDS Committee of Toronto (ACT) is established. LINK
  • National task force on AIDS started, (later National Advsory Committee on AIDS appointed by the Canadian Minister of National Health and Welfare. LINK
  • The first published report of a case of AIDS found in a Canadian hemophiliac - Canada Diseases Weekly Report. LINK

AIDS Vancouver - Prevent. Act. Support.
Celebrating 30 Years of AIDS Vancouver
  • 30th Anniversary RSVP
  • Donate
  • Acknowledgements

AIDS Vancouver plays a special role in providing quality health care to people affected by HIV/AIDS living in the Lower Mainland. It is clearly more than just a community health care organization. It is an organization whose presence and continued strength is essential to the quality for life of this community and of each individual and family who draws on its services.

Our Agency is a vital community asset which everyone affected by HIV/AIDS can share, and in which we all have a stake.

Visit us at aidsvancouver.org

2013 © AIDS Vancouver
